department_name: Fresno County Department of Public Health - Environmental Health Division

grading_system.description: No letter grading system identified - uses major/minor violation classification system only

inspection_details.frequency: Based on risk assessment and facility type - routine inspections conducted at unannounced intervals
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Major violations require reinspection unless immediately corrected during routine inspection
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Inspection reports available online at fresnohealthinspections.com; facilities required to post notice that reports available for public review and maintain copy on-site

fire_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Fire-suppression systems must be inspected and certified by C-16 Fire Protection Contractor or State Fire Marshal 'A' License holder every 6 months with NFPA 17 or 17a certificate of completion

regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County level inspections conducted by Fresno County Environmental Health Division
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: County-specific requirements for food facility construction, mobile food vendors, commissary authorization

confidence_notes: Clear documentation on regulatory framework, fire safety requirements, and inspection processes. However, no definitive grading/scoring system found despite extensive search - Grand Jury report explicitly notes Fresno County does not use letter grades unlike many CA counties.
verification_notes: Need to verify specific grading methodology if any exists beyond major/minor violation classification. Grand Jury report from 2023-2024 indicates system deficiencies and lack of letter grading, but should confirm current practices and any recent changes to inspection scoring methodology.

inspection_details.frequency: Routine inspections conducted, frequency not specified
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Inspection results available online at county website database

fire_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Commercial cooking systems shall be operated and maintained in accordance to Title 19 California Code of Regulations Chapter 5

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Health and Safety Code Division 104 Part 7 (California Retail Food Code)
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County level inspections conducted by Merced County Environmental Health
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Merced County Code Title 9 General Health and Safety

confidence_notes: Grading system confirmed through news source reporting county's point-based system with good/satisfactory/unsatisfactory ratings. California Retail Food Code basis confirmed. Fire safety requirements confirmed through county documents.
verification_notes: Should verify exact inspection frequency schedule and confirm if there are numerical score ranges associated with the good/satisfactory/unsatisfactory ratings. Fire safety inspection requirements confirmed but frequency should be verified with county fire marshal.
